item.title: Liz add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Don't Panic." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Liz add a quote by John Fowles
item.description: "We all write poems; it is simply that poets are the ones who write in words." -- John Fowles

item.title: Liz add a quote by W.P. Kinsella
item.description:
"God what an outfield,' he says. 'What a left field.' He looks up at me, and I look down at him. 'This must be heaven,' he says.
No. It's Iowa,' I reply automatically. But then I feel the night rubbing softly against my face like cherry blossoms; look at the sleeping girl-child in my arms, her small hand curled around one of my fingers; think of the fierce warmth of the woman waiting for me in the house; inhale the fresh-cut grass small that seems locked in the air like permanent incense; and listen to the drone of the crowd, as below me Shoelss Joe Jackson tenses, watching the angle of the distant bat for a clue as to where the ball will be hit.
I think you're right, Joe,' I say, but softly enough not to disturb his concentration." -- W.P. Kinsella

item.title: Liz add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The man in black fled across the desert, and the gunslinger followed." -- Stephen King

item.title: Liz add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I'd take the awe of understanding over the awe of ignorance any day." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family. " -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Magic comes from what is inside you. It is a part of you. You can't weave together a spell that you don't beleive in." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Liz add a quote by Christopher Moore
Liz add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "People who talk about their dreams are actually trying to tell you things about themselves they’d never admit in normal conversation." -- Chuck Klosterman

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "You," Madeline said, her voice hollow and wheezing, "are like a bad case of herpes, wizard. You're inconvenient, embarassing, no real threat, and you simply <i>will not</i> go away." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Liz add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "I was struck to my heart and through my heart, knocked clean out of my ordinary life." -- Stephen King

item.title: Liz add a quote by Philip Pullman
Liz add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "The door burst open. Murphy came through it, her eyes living flames of azure blue, her hair a golden coronet around her. She held a blazing sword in her hand and she shone so bright and beautiful and terrifying in her anger that it was hard to see. The Sight, I realized, dimly. I was seeing her for who she was." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "The noise was deafening, and no one could have heard me anyway as I let out my own battle cry, which I figured was worth a shot. What the hell. "I DON'T BELIEVE IN FAERIES!" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Don't mess with a wizard when he's wizarding!" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Liz add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "Half a dozen brats turned with expressions of derision, and Lyra threw her cigarette down, recognizing the cue for a fight. Everyone's daemon instantly became warlike: each child was accompanied by fangs, or claws, or bristling fur, and Pantalaimon, contemptuous of the limited imaginations of these gyptian daemons, became a dragon the size of a deer hound." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Liz add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "Let children learn about different faiths, let them notice their incompatibility, and let them draw their own conclusions about the consequences of that incompatibility. As for whether they are ‘valid,’ let them make up their own minds when they are old enough to do so." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description:
"Are you always a smartass?'
Nope. Sometimes I'm asleep." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Of course Evil's afoot. If it had switched to the metric system it'd be up to a meter by now. " -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "I let out a battle cry. Sure, a lot of people might have mistaken it for a sudden yelp of unmanly fear, but trust me. It was a battle cry." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Liz add a quote by OMAR KHAYYAM
item.description: "Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life." -- OMAR KHAYYAM
